description: Advisory published a client disconnects to the NATS Server
title: io.nats.server.advisory.v1.client_disconnect

id.description: Unique correlation ID for this event

timestamp.description: The time this event was created in RFC3339 format

server.description: Details about the server the client connected to

name.description: The configured name for the server, matches ID when unconfigured

host.description: The host this server runs on, typically a IP address

id.description: The unique server ID for this node

cluster.description: The cluster the server belongs to

ver.description: The version NATS running on the server

jetstream.description: Indicates if this server has JetStream enabled

time.description: The local time of the server

client.description: Details about the client that connected to the server

host.description: The remote host the client is connected from

id.description: The internally assigned client ID for this connection

acc.description: The account this user logged in to

name.description: The name presented by the client during connection

lang.description: The programming language library in use by the client

ver.description: The version of the client library in use

rtt.description: The last known latency between the NATS Server and the Client in nanoseconds

server.description: The server that the client was connected to

cluster.description: The cluster name the server is connected to

jwt.description: The JWT presented in the connection

issuer_key.description: The public signing key or account identity key used to issue the user

name_tag.description: The name extracted from the user JWT claim

kind.description: The kind of client. Can be Client/Leafnode/Router/Gateway/JetStream/Account/System

client_type.description: The type of client. When kind is Client, this contains the type: mqtt/websocket/nats

msgs.description: The number of messages handled by the client

bytes.description: The number of bytes handled by the client

msgs.description: The number of messages handled by the client
